response: "{ \"title\": \"Medium: Fibonacci Sequence Validator\", \"description\": \"Create a function that determines if a given list of numbers follows the rules of the Fibonacci sequence. A number can be part of the Fibonacci sequence if it is equal to the sum of the two preceding ones, starting from 0 and 1.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef validate_fibonacci(arr: List[int]) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (List[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input list follows the rules of the Fibonacci sequence, `False` otherwise. The function should return `False` for lists with less than 3 elements.\\n\", \"code\": \"from typing import List\\n\\ndef validate_fibonacci(arr: List[int]) -> bool:\\n    if len(arr) < 3:\\n        return False\\n    for i in range(2, len(arr)):\\n        if arr[i] != arr[i-1] + arr[i-2]:\\n            return False\\n    return True\", \"tests\": [\"assert validate_fibonacci([0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5]) == True\", \"assert validate_fibonacci([0, 1, 2, 4, 8]) == False\", \"assert validate_fibonacci([0, 1]) == False\"] }"
